content.en: Haplotype inference: Scientists have developed new algorithms that can accurately and rapidly infer haplotypes for a large number of linked SNPs, overcome limitations of existing approaches to understanding linkage disequilibrium, estimate population haplotype frequency, select optimal SNPs in a genomic region, estimate haplotype frequencies and standard errors, construct linkage disequilibrium maps, perform disease-gene mapping, identify disease genes and pharmacogenomics, distinguish between blocked and unblocked regions in the genome, model linkage disequilibrium during multipoint analysis, analyze homozygous haplotypes, cluster haplotypes for population association studies, reduce bias in maximum likelihood estimation, adjust traditional linkage analysis methods, calculate IBD probabilities, enhance association mapping power, and perform joint linkage and linkage disequilibrium analysis. These algorithms are based on Bayesian approaches, statistical models, Markov chain Monte Carlo algorithms, spectral decomposition, haplotype tagging SNP selection, likelihood formulation, progressive ligation computational algorithm, cladistic analysis, in silico haplotype phasing strategies, approximate likelihood models, gene-counting algorithms, hidden Markov models, density-based haplotype clustering, and the PSEUDOMARKER software package.
content.da: Haplotypeinferens: Forskere har udviklet nye algoritmer, der præcist og hurtigt kan inferere haplotyper for et stort antal koblede SNP'er, overvinde begrænsningerne ved eksisterende metoder til at forstå koblingsuligevægt, estimere populations haplotypefrekvens, vælge optimale SNP'er i en genomisk region, estimere haplotypefrekvenser og standardfejl, konstruere koblingsuligevægtkort, udføre sygdoms-genkortlægning, identificere sygdomsgener og farmakogenomik, skelne mellem blokerede og ikke-blokerede regioner i genomet, modellere koblingsuligevægt under multipunkt-analyse, analysere homozygote haplotyper, klynge haplotyper til populationsassocieringsstudier, reducere skævhed i maksimum likelihood-estimation, justere traditionelle koblingsanalysemetoder, beregne IBD-sandsynligheder, øge power i associeringskortlægning og udføre fælles koblings- og koblingsuligevægtanalyse. Disse algoritmer er baseret på bayesianske tilgange, statistiske modeller, Markov chain Monte Carlo-algoritmer, spektral dekomposition, haplotypetagging SNP-udvælgelse, likelihood-formulering, progressiv ligationsberegningsalgoritme, kladistisk analyse, in silico haplotyperphasingsstrategier, tilnærmede likelihood-modeller, genoptællingsalgoritmer, skjulte Markov-modeller, tæthedsbaseret haplotypeklyngning og PSEUDOMARKER-softwarepakken.
